file_content.text: Hah! Just like old times! I haven't been chased by marauding life forms on an expedition since you disappeared. Quite missed the thrill of it.
We couldn't have done it without you, my lord. This should be everything I need.
Hah! I haven't been on an excavation quite this thrilling since my old master vanished. Never a dull moment when it comes to Sith archaeology, you know.
You were a great help. These specimens should be more then enough to conduct the necessary tests.
Anything to help bring down the Eternal Empire.
Just find something good for practical use.
On the honor of the Drellik family, I'll find something worth pursuing.
Alas, moon of Yavin, we part again with your air of mystery unblemished. So, where are we headed next, my lord?
To Odessen, I have allies there who are eager to meet you.
Odessen? I've never heard of it. I should bring my journal.
I'm glad to have you back, Talos. I've missed our chats.
As have I. As have I.
Wherever my mood leads me, be sure to keep up.
You are truly a lightning rod for wonders.
So, this Alliance of yours, it requires individuals of learning and conviction?
It does. We have to understand how the Eternal Empire so easily overpowered us.
Then it sounds like the perfect lot to throw in with. Truth be told, the Empire doesn't have its heart in that fight yet.
Dr. Oggurobb thinks so anyway.
You've done so much for my research and asked nothing in return. I am in your debt.
I can see why Oggurobb thought you'd be a good fit for the Alliance. We could use people like you.
You're a colleague of Doctor Juvard Oggurobb? That's wonderful news. I couldn't ask for a better engineering consultant.
There is something I'd like in return. I command an Alliance against Zakuul. I want you to join us.
Not just a lucky turn of events after all, but still auspicious. Truth be told, the Empire doesn't have its heart in that fight yet.
I'll begin preparations to depart the Yavin system forthwith. Exciting times lay ahead!
Welcome back, my lord. Still no word on our support and the Massassi remain an obstacle.
I will handle them.
Back again? You're welcome to take shelter from the elements for as long as you like. Given any more thought to my request?
Yes, I've come back to help you.
[Refuse Mission] I still can't help you.
Wishful thinking, I suppose. Safe travels.
Oh--my lord! It's good to see you whole! I'd half-expected to encounter your ghost in a place like this. Hoped, really.
It's good to see you alive as well, Talos.
Not to cast a pall on the good news, but I'd given quite a bit of thought to your tomb. The ancients would have envied it.
You hoped I was dead?
Many believed you had already passed on. I thought you might be able to reach out to me in a place like this.
It would have been only a minor setback for a Sith of your cunning and knowledge, I'm sure of it!
Still clawing through the dirt, I see.
You know me, lord--no one else can show the care of a true archaeologist. Bridging the past and the future takes such a careful hand.
Welcome to Yavin 4, my lord.
This is not the first time you've been here, I know, nor will it be the last, I'm sure. A lifetime of knowledge is buried on this world.
What secrets have brought you here now?
Combating the Order of Revan left me little time for exploration.
It's criminal that so much of your time gets stolen away from your true calling. This might cheer you up!
I can feel the dark side pulsing through this place in ways both familiar and foreign.
Echoes of the ancient alchemy of Naga Sadow? Oh--or possibly the man himself? They say his ghost still dwells on this world.
Perhaps you're even feeling the very thing I'm researching. Could it be calling to you? Wouldn't that be something!
No need for a welcome, we won't be staying.
As you say, my lord. Might I share my findings with you before we pack things in? You may find them interesting.
I came to Yavin 4 to study the mechanisms of the Temple of Sacrifice. Your strike team was quite thorough disabling it, but portions are still woven throughout the area.
My theory is that this ancient piece of technology may share traits with others built by the Sith Emperor.
Such as the Eternal Throne. Good thinking, Talos.
Spot on, my lord.
And your findings so far?
You realize how preposterous that sounds?
I know that it's a tenuous connection, but without access to relics of the Eternal Empire this long shot is the best we have.
What little has been revealed about Zakuul indicates that their Eternal Fleet is attuned directly to their emperor's will.
The Temple of Sacrifice seemed attuned to our former emperor in a similar way. If you'd help me exhume a few samples, we could take them for analysis.
Very well, let's not dally about.
Can't your team handle that?
The Massassi warriors dwelling here seem unnaturally drawn to our areas of interest. I've been trying to get military support for a while now.
I see why you brought it up to me. I'll handle them.
[Refuse Mission] It's not a priority for them, or for me.
It just feels like wasted potential left laying about. Chin up, our day will come!
[Bypass Mission] That is far more trouble than it's worth when there are other options.
[Refuse Mission] That's not something I have time for right now.
[Bypass Mission] You've wasted enough time on this hunch of yours. I have need of you elsewhere.
Of course, my lord. I wouldn't put my own vanity above the needs of my master.
I can't wait to hear what you've learned of Zakuul. To think, you were the first to make direct contact with such a remote society!
Stand down, team! I'd wager we're not looking at an attack. No need to pick a fight.
Jedi are usually quite reasonable. So what brings you out today? A disturbance in the Force? Oh--or the seductive call of the dark side?
You, actually. You come highly recommended as a scholar and my Alliance needs great minds to defeat the Eternal Empire.
The dark side is no joking matter.
Too true, I've spent enough time in Sith tombs to pay it a healthy respect. That was insensitive--my apologies.
You have the look of Special Forces. Scouts, perhaps? So long as you don't trample our work, I'm happy to let you go about yours.
I'm more interested in cooperating. You come highly recommended as a scholar and my Alliance needs great minds to defeat the Eternal Empire.
Are you always this cordial to your enemies?
It's never been in my nature to judge a tome by its bindings.
You think scouts would just walk up and announce themselves to the opposing force?
It would be a first, but since you're here I thought I'd clarify our intentions.
Unless, of course, you're a looter. I simply can't abide tomb robbers.
I'm more interested in picking at your brain than a tomb wall. You come highly recommended and my Alliance needs great minds to defeat the Eternal Empire.
Hey! I wouldn't dream of taking anything that doesn't belong to me.
Then I apologize for casting aspersions on your character.
Yeah, with all the deadly traps and horrifying ghosts, it's you guys I should be afraid of.
You wouldn't be the first to underestimate the wherewithal of the Imperial Reclamation Service, but deadly traps and ghosts are our daily victuals!
Ho! A friendly face. We don't see that too often out here.
Lord Wrath. Have you come in search of lingering traces of the Sith Emperor? Oh--or yet another hidden scheme missed in the battle with Revan?
Nothing so dire. You come highly recommended as a scholar and my Alliance needs great minds to defeat the Eternal Empire.
You seem rather eager for calamity.
Perish the thought. I only imagine that whatever business brought you here is of great import. I'm intrigued.
What I do is not your concern unless I deign to make it so.
Forgive me for forgetting my place.
My, are you a Mandalorian? Fascinating culture. Carrying on the traditions of an ancient co-mingled species--not unlike our Sith Empire.
You must be the one I'm looking for. My Alliance needs researchers like you to defeat the Eternal Empire.
Guess I've got more in common with you Imps than I thought.
It's not my area of expertise but I know the Mandalorians and Sith have a long history. I'd love to compare our records of it.
There's no comparison.
Nonsense! The long histories share a--oh, I take your meaning. Forgive me if I caused offense.
You haven't been hired to ransack the tombs, have you?
It's you I'm here for. My Alliance needs researchers like you to defeat the Eternal Empire.
Treasure isn't my preferred form of hunting.
Well, that's a relief. So much is already destroyed by conflict, why add plunder to the mix?
You calling me a crook?
Apologies if I've insulted. I just have an interest in preservation and if your business is contrary to that, I thought we could work something out.
Especially not one bearing the hallmarks of a covert operative. Sith Intelligence?
Not quite. You come highly recommended as a scholar and my Alliance needs great minds to defeat the Eternal Empire.
My reputation precedes me? I'm quite tickled.
Formerly Imperial Intelligence. Now, more independent.
I'm no stranger to unconventional career paths myself. Life prefers winding paths, and they really are more scenic anyway.
And you're with the Imperial Reclamation Service.
Recently returned, after a stint in the direct service of a member of the Dark Council.
Talos Drellik, at your service. Welcome to my humble expedition.
I know what you're thinking: "What dastardly evil could they be unearthing here?" The answer is less sinister than you might assume.
We're studying the Temple of Sacrifice, or parts related anyway. In hindsight I realize that isn't helping my case.
You're right, that was destroyed attempting to prevent the Sith Emperor's resurrection. No good can come of it.
Even if it were inherently evil, which I doubt, knowing its workings can be used for good.
You should elaborate. Quickly.
I know what you're thinking: "With all the turmoil of the last five years, why devote resources to something like this?" Our interest isn't purely academic.
Knowledge is power and here lays the closest technological cousin of the Eternal Empire: the Temple of Sacrifice.
That temple was destroyed in the battle with Revan. For good reason.
Oh yes, it's essential functions are antithetical to our goal, but this isn't an act of restoration.
Temple of Sacrifice?
A device intended to feed power to the Sith Emperor through offerings of the living. No longer functional after the fight with Revan.
The two are related?
That's my hypothesis.
I don't really need to hear about your work here.
If your fight really is with the Eternal Empire, I beg to differ.
If you have a stake in the future of our galaxy, I would beg to differ.
The temple was created by the Emperor's design, much like the Eternal Empire. I suspect there could be shared elements in the technology.
We're working to exhume functional samples, but the Massassi make the work quite dangerous.
If you're right, this might give us an edge against the Eternal Empire. I'll help however I can.
Why are the Massassi dangerous?
They are ancient Sith bred into hulking warriors through the alchemy of Exar Kun himself. A wondrous anthropological find, were they not so bloodthirsty.
I can take you to Zakuul for that. You've wasted enough time here.
Quite an offer, but I would be remiss to leave potential breakthroughs unexplored. Especially when we're so close to a discovery.
With your assistance I think we could gather what we need before departing. Wouldn't take a day, even.
Lead the way, Talos.
That's the spirit! Here are the locations we should search. I'll be right behind you!
[Refuse Mission] I can't right now.
A shame. We'll just have to wait for support to arrive. They're weeks out I'm afraid. We'll be here if you change your mind.
Centuries old... sometimes I forget the kind of being our Sith Emperor really was.
Brr. Did you feel a shiver down your spine too?
Without the Force, these mechanisms simply wouldn't function.
Almost finished. I've identified one more sample to excavate.
There, that should do it. We should return to camp before any of these pieces are damaged.
This world is a wonder. Such darkness just beneath a tranquil surface.
Strange... there are pieces here that shouldn't be found together. Very strange.
The time periods are completely at odds... hmm....
In any case, an investigation for another day. Let's continue with our present task.
More elements that don't belong. Hmm.
Another piece out of place. I can't quite put my finger on it.
